reviews.text: We stayed in a sub-penthouse and spent a week here and couldn't fault it. The room was clean and new and more than enough space to accommodate our group. Everything was there, air-conditioning, comfortable beds, fully fitted out kitchen, laundry, secure underground parking, pool area & BBQ, big screen TV, great view, and with security access for the access and lifts for peace of mind. The location is perfect with a coffee shop/restaurant in the basement and central to the main road. We specifically stayed here to get away from the Gold Coast/Coolangatta areas. It's quiet here and right opposite a patrolled beach. When we ate we either went downstairs or into nearby Coolangatta or up to the Gold Coast for a trip. It's a little further away to the Theme Parks and Surfers Paradise than the more popular locations, which is why we picked it, but it's straight onto the motorway to get there. I though we would get a little noise from the airport but I was surprised that other than the odd flight when the wind changed, we weren't really bothered. Actually, the only criticism is that the spa on the top deck isn't heated, if it was we would still be there !
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: My husband and our parents stayed in one of the penthouses recently and had an absolutely wonderful stay. The apartment itself was spotless, very modern and supplied with everything we needed. The views were amazing and the location very convenient. Staff were great and very helpful. It was meant to be a weekend to remember for us and it was - thanks to Kirra Surf Apts. We'll definitely be returning in the future.
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.text: The staff was very courteous and helpful. We arrived at 9am and was allowed to get the apartment straight away. It was very nice and clean. We stayed in room 606 with a perfect ocean view as was promised. We would definitely recommend Kirrasurf apartment. Thank you management for the good service.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Apartment was neat, tidy and had plenty of space.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Had a beautiful view from the patio.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: Our stay was mainly great. We had a plunge pool although didn't use it as we didn't go to the Gold Coast for that. Kitchen facilities were good.
reviews.title: DISGUSTED

reviews.text: Air conditioning broke in one room which made it FREEZING. Apparently you can't have heat and cool at the same time.
reviews.title: Affordable Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also wanted to check out at 12 instead of 10 as our flight was delayed and were charged $50 for 2hours. Un-impressed.
reviews.title: Great location and amazing stay!

reviews.text: But the BIGGEST concern was after we left.
reviews.title: Family Holiday

reviews.text: We neatly put the rubbish to the side of the kitchen and put towels in the washing machine.
reviews.title: Great view East & West, Clean, Friendly & Quiet!!

reviews.text: Stayed at Kirra Surf Apartment for the third time and loved it just as much. Fantastic views, Well equipped rooms with everything you could ever want. Great restaurants nearby and Kirra Surf offers everything a surfer could want. HIghly recommend staying at this lovely apartment with fantastic staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Views

reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay in a 3 bedroom apartment on the 7th floor for a girls weekend away. The apartments appear to be individually owned and as such have unique decor - we had a very clean and calm apartment with a modern beach aesthetic which we enjoyed. We enjoyed cooking a fair bit, and the kitchen was really lovely to work in (except for the under counter sinks, although they look so nice). No proper sharp knives, but apartments never do! There was a teapot and a large coffee plunger - yay!
reviews.title: I love Kirra!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 7th floor meant perfect ocean views - many whale spouts were spotted with the occasional breaching, glorious sunrise over Coolangatta, easy access to the beach, walkways, restaurants, and a lovely pool (I could see my kids absolutely loving it). The best restaurant (Burger Lounge), wonderful gelati shop, a lovely beauty spa (Kirra Beach Beauty) and the NightOwl were a 750m easy walk away.
reviews.title: Fabulous beach break

reviews.text: The main bedroom and ensuite were massive and spacious with huge amounts of storage. The 2nd and 3rd bedrooms were cosy - would be perfect for a family, a little squishier for us. And one room had unreliable air-con, so it got hot at night. My bed was a bit soft for me, but that's probably just me. The 2nd bathroom was tiny - make sure you are nice to whomever is in the big room. Free Austar with movie channels and DVD/CD player - we couldn't find an Ipod dock for those to whom that is important. We hardly saw reception - we were so comfortable with where we were we didn't ask for much. Any check in requests were easily accommodated. Only a few picky cleaning issues - the glass balustrades and sliding doors were a bit grimy as was the outdoor table - although keeping them clean would be very difficult, but it did cut down on the view. There was such a wind the first couple of days that we often had to keep the doors closed, but on the last couple of perfect days, you wouldn't change location for anything!
reviews.title: Great Girls weekend

reviews.text: We had a fantastic 4 night stay Aug/Sep and never wanted to leave. Beautiful modern apartment on the 7th floor with fabulous ocean views - even saw the whales. The apartment itself was faultless! The only drawback was hearing the traffic (particularly noisy buses/trucks) whilst the balcony doors were open, however we never heard the neighbours in other apartments so night time was quiet. Happy to return anytime!! Thank you for having us!
reviews.title: Wonderful birthday experience

reviews.text: Jackie, Lloyd and Kim-Marie, were absolutely wonderful and welcoming. They helped to make my 50th Birthday celebration a fantastic and memorable time. The unit we were going to stay in (903) sub penthouse is very nicely furnished but we were very lucky to receive an upgrade to a much bigger balcony which although itself needed a little sprucing being open to the elements it was absolutely perfect for a few celebratory champagnes and canapes with close friends and family. The location of Kirra Surf and amenities were great but the lovely hosts made it so much better. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location and place to stay

reviews.text: Our second time at Kirra Surf, in a 3 bedroom apartment. The apartments are clean and spacious, and the two we have stayed in have fantastic views from the large patios. Management are helpful and obliging. Our only problem was a spa bath that didn't work, but they immediately tried to fix it, and offered us another apartment when they couldn't.
reviews.title: January 2013

reviews.text: We also enjoyed having dinner in the restaurant downstairs. Both the food and service was excellent.
reviews.title: Amazing Kirra Surf Apartments

reviews.text: My family stayed at Kirra Surf over the Xmas/New Year period. Apartment 902 is a must! Very spacious with the best views on the Gold Coast from the huge and very private balcony (We lived out their)! Management were very friendly and helpful and obvioulsy do a great job for their owners as the complex always looked wonderful. The pool area is great for families. Beaches, cafes and walking/cycling path at your front door. This is the perfect holiday and we will be back.
reviews.title: Lovely apartment but a little lacking in warmth

reviews.text: Marnie
reviews.title: Whale Watching
